bow: really tired of being asked who watches your kid while work seriously every time someone finds out have one year old and full time job it the first question out of their mouths it almost always said in condescending or appalled tone who watches your kid why does it matter to them why is it even their business it getting old seriously on the verge of saying oh just leave him to his own devices he fine should have to explain my child care situation to complete strangers or even coworkers are these younger or single people that do have kids have to assume when people ask that it because they are curious about how the whole parenting thing works like they might like to have kid someday but ca quite wrap their mind around it they probably relate to you on some level…maybe similar age or social class and are trying to figure out how person like them could actually pull it off or maybe they have kid but no job and just wonder how you manage both if another parent asked me that would assume they are just curious about my daycare arrangements as compared to them but it probably would be phrased who watches your kid you re right you do have to explain anything to anyone but to be honest they are probably just admiring how you ve managed to accomplish it all the only female that works at my job and it almost always men that ask think it frustrates me because if were my husband no one would ask him you know he works as much as do but no one ever asks him the tone is very do know it irks me put him in his crib with bottle and leave the tv on why my husband told me to say he got kennel just like the dog it does sounds annoying but if it just the men maybe their wives just stayed home and they are wondering what you have going on maybe like how they can get their wife to go back to work too or they may be little jealous that you did to go back where they had to support their wife you know when ask fellow moms that it because trying to grok possibilities so can get back to work or so can learn new strategies for any woman to get back to work it very tough to manage in the us at least and we need to learn ideas and strategies feedback from each other hope we can all keep this spirit of honest inquiry in mind when someone asks they may be seeking way themselves or trying to learn how it works of course it none of our business but it such huge problem to solve that we re all looking for stories of what has worked mentioned it elsewhere but all of my coworkers are male and older most of them have kids my age idk it just it makes me feel crappy the way they ask up vote for grok used to tell people that trained my dog to care for my daughter so could work yep was thinking this too their first intent is to find out what with your husband…this is their way of asking if your husband stays home with the baby get the same thing or people just ask is grandma watching her when say daycare get looks like am sending her to hell everyday then inevitably start feeling even more guilt for putting her there yeah that sorta how feel say he has baby sitter but then feel the need to follow up that she absolutely incredible think that why this gets to me it hard enough leaving him every morning so when people ask it like reminder that someone else has my kid no no you put him *in* the kennel *with* the dog that way the dog can babysit like nana in peter pan would recommend ever even joking about leaving them alone it ends in tears the same tone goes for guys who ask what sahms do all day keep on truckin mama yep this might be different they might have no understanding of how difficult this whole thing is from woman perspective and no respect sorry if so 100 respect from me though me too it does help that work from home and most of my work is on the computer by myself without lot of interaction with others ca help but think that they are implying that do my work with year old hanging on my leg yes work from home but still send my kid to daycare so can work nope no way do not feel crappy no no crappy feelings uh uh stop because you know what fuck those guys their problem is that they all are lazy they have stay at home wives who take care of their kids and then take care of their lazy asses when they get home they do pitch in around the house they view themselves as the breadwinners while it their wives jobs to watch the littles the reason they re flabbergasted that you work and have baby is that it calls into question the validity of their lack of participation in the home if you work during the day and take care of your child at night then are their wives suddenly going to start expecting the same of them god forbid so seriously fuck those guys they re just trying to justify their own life decisions by razzing you for yours so yeah tell them they you bought one of those wall esque chairs for your baby that the ipad snaps into and you just leave him in it with few cheerios he totally fine asshole went through that too it like none of us can win story time it true somebody else *does* have your kid but if you ve worked through this thing entirely it settled in your mind and heart that you chose this because it was best for either you him or the family and then can confidently share this with others whenever you re so inclined of course you really might not be inclined with jerky coworkers think huge crucial part of taking time away from the kids and putting them with babysitter daycare etc that is often neglected is encouraging women to really take their time think it through and decide fully based on the lives we have and the choices we have or do have what is best *would* we really rather drop the money and the career advancement and have time with the kids or are we better with keeping the career money do we even have suitable temperament for either one and then having it settled fully and proceeding with calm assurance that yes there ll be bumps along the way but this is what really seemed the right path know all women take these mental steps but so often it seems like society or family members try to rush the woman into preconceived assumed path of action screw that this is our one life wanted to be mother more than anything going to soak up every minute with my kids my great education and earning potential be damned other moms will have had lifelong dreams of careers they might want to keep that career the whole way through motherhood they might want to take quick pause and then get back to their career other moms will feel like me that they most want time with their kids but find on introspection that they really ca make it work *or* that they really want that career but ca make it work and then these women are really making huge sacrifices sorry this has turned into bit of rant just hope more support is given women and men to really think through their choices and really examine their hearts and then for society to really support their choices and all our families gt when say daycare get looks like am sending her to hell everyday was sitting here reading all these replies wondering why nobody seems to grasp the obvious answer of daycare did not realize there was such severe stigma against daycare someone says to me have child and work full time and my first thought is oh what daycare do you use be more surprised to hear of child of working parents that *doesn t* go to daycare do feel guilty though actually wish could send my kid to daycare because hear so many stories of how kids thrive there making friends to play with expanding their vocabulary learning all kinds of junk but alas the cost it really makes me want to grab these assholes by the tie and be like alright what should do with my life why do you tell me how to be woman correctly what is the correct way to be female and have child educate me master deleted the thing is tried staying home it just not for me was starting to become resentful of my husband and son felt trapped my depression was wrapping me up my husband was constantly stressed because we did have second income everyone is so much happier now that working does it absolutely blow on nights get stuck working late and my son is already asleep when get home oh god yes but when have my days off excited to sit on the floor with him to play with his toys and tickle him and read him stories appreciate everything so much more now just hate feeling like people think *should* be home with him it hurts me doing what best for my family you know this is exactly how it makes me feel seriously my son is my whole world love to have the wherewithal or financial stability to stay home with him but just do wish heard more about the positives it really is just our only option right now luckily absolutely love the ladies that take care of her there they are sweet and really trust them in reality they are more capable than grandma is anyway but it is true people really look down on it share has lots of fun activities to do and nice set schedule which is always good thing with little ones love my kid daycare he thrives there in way am absolutely certain would not be the case if he were home with me am not creative kid wrangler so would probably spend my time running errands with him watching tv and cleaning the house am proud of my son daycare am happy to partner with them to there well recognised stereotypical behaviour that paediatric general practice doctors and nurses note and it is this if the kid is ill all day they might be getting slightly worse over the day mum is reassured because she seen it evolve over hours and dad is shocked because he remembers them entirely well at 7am dad seizes the child and attends doctor intent on answers there are few confounding factors here one is that in many families the one in paid work is dad and he might have the only transport so the kid can only go to the doctor after dad gets home the reassured mother might be appropriately our inappropriately reassured the assumed behaviour in the stereotype though is either that dad is unwilling to look after normally ill child and is seeking amelioration of symptoms that mum was putting up with or that the child is fine and mum knows for example this diarrhoea is consequence of teething but dad has been keeping track had forgotten the infant age etc so that the
